Info.Description: Generates Simplex noise, which is an improved form of Perlin noise. Simplex noise produces a smoother and less computationally intensive noise pattern, with less visible grid-like artifacts.

Properties.Name: Octaves
Properties.Summary: Controls the number of layers of noise that are generated. Each additional octave adds a layer of noise at half the size of the previous one, which creates a more complex and detailed noise pattern. A higher number of octaves results in more detail and complexity, but may also be more computationally intensive.

Properties.Name: Scale
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the size of the noise pattern. A larger scale increases the size of the features in the noise, creating fewer but larger areas of color. A smaller scale decreases the feature size, resulting in a more detailed noise pattern with more, smaller areas of color.

Properties.Name: Gradient
Properties.Summary: Selects the colors that will be used in the Simplex noise. The gradient is interpolated over the grayscale noise values. Each point in the noise pattern is assigned a color from the gradient based on its value, with low values taking colors from one end of the gradient and high values from the other end.
